newsitem.title: USA: Hilton asks court to delay March 5 hearing.
newsitem.headline: Hilton asks court to delay March 5 hearing.

text.p: Hilton Hotels Corp has asked a federal court to delay a March 5 hearing on Hilton's motion to enjoin ITT Corp from any interference with the election process of its board of directors.
Marc Grossman, Hilton's senior vice president corporate affairs, said Hilton asked for the delay in a letter delivered late on Wednesday to U.S. District Judge Philip Pro in Nevada.
The request coincides with Hilton's filing of a new motion seeking to compel ITT to hold its annual meeting in mid-May.
"We have made that request because in our view this motion and the previous motion are both related to the general subject of insuring a fair and orderly election process," Grossman said.
"In our view, it makes sense to hear both motions at the same time," he added.
Hilton did not ask for a specific date for a new hearing, but did say one could take place as soon as late-March or early April, Grossman said.
"Obviously we'll comply with whatever the court's wishes are as far as (a date for) hearing the motions," he said.
Judge Pro has until the March 5 hearing date to grant the request for a delay.
